title: The Seeds of Death
dialogue_triumphs: The Doctor: 'Your leader will be angry if you kill me… I'm a genius!'
goofs: In episode one, the Doctor leaves the TARDIS with his braces unclipped.
There are boom-mike shadows several times in the museum in the first two episodes.
In episode four, Slaar insists on killing the Doctor by T-matting him into space, even though this will take ages to do.
The Ice Warrior helper does a bizarre dance when leaving the T-mat on Earth.
The Doctor's sideburns grow while he's unconscious.
In episode five, Eldred points to the Weather Control Bureau on the map, but it's clearly marked in the opposite corner.
Ice Warriors are shown fainting at heat between 40-50° centigrade, which would also have killed the humans present.
Zoe refers to Slaar as Slaar but nobody else knows or mentions his name.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space machine
continuity_notes.current_status: Controls aren't accurate enough for a trip from Earth to the moon

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: The main protagonist, a Time Lord
continuity_notes.current_status: Expert enough at space flight to pilot a rocket

continuity_notes.name: Zoe
continuity_notes.current_status: Has total recall and has never heard of the Ice Warriors

continuity_notes.name: Ice Warriors
continuity_notes.current_status: Attempting to colonize Earth as their planet is dying

technobabble: Slaar to the Grand Marshal: 'Use your retroactive rockets to change course.'
roots: The 1962 film of The Day of the Triffids

locations.name: Britain
locations.current_status: Setting for parts of the story in the 21st century

future_history: Earth has given up rocket travel for the Travelmat Relay. Features of 21st-century life include synthetic carbohydrates, speaking computers, weather control, satellite communications, and video phones. However, ordinary guns, British knighthoods, and the UN Security Council remain. Petrol cars are only found in museums.
additional_notes: Fashion Victims: The nappy uniforms of the T-mat staff, and the guards' silly helmets.
bottom_line: Some interesting direction, but horribly edited. Plod, plod, how many episodes left to the end of the season, lads?
